title: OUC 2016 FAQ and Rules
body:
Hey everyone,

http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/scale_xlarge/public/upload/unitournamentarticle1_header.jpg?itok=qv2DfX8p

[Full announcement and details](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/community/community-events/its-time-rally-your-classmates)

I'll be editing common questions and answers to them below in this post;

Here you can find a full version of the [rules for OUC](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QJNY5pk2abYrdXbC5S6vN2u6pysZRQNSZTpXe4Ix02M/)

If you want to get involved check out our club directory to find your University club - http://promo.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/uni-clubs/

If your uni doesn't have a listed club here's how you can get a club on the directory.

* Start a facebook group/page and get 5+ members
* Create your first event! (This could be a meet up, play session or tournament etc)
* Apply to be listed on the club directory on the [Register a club page](http://promo.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/uni-clubs/register.html)

Here are some helpful tips to run a successful club!
http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/clubs/pBvRRPrW-looking-to-start-a-uni-club-here-are-some-useful-resources

replies.body:
How do you determine the rank of the player in question? Is it their individual soloq ranking or is it the teams overall ranking in ranked 5's? 

Cause I'm only in Gold elo for example, but I'm easily a plat player and stomp face most games. I just haven't had the time to hit plat again just yet. If I were to play against silvers in a tournament there would be no contest; I'd annihilate them. That seems unfair.

Hey man,

There isn't currently a ranked 5s ladder. So it is based on your Ranked rating. We recommend Plat + for Division 1 however all Ranked tiers are welcome to join Division one if they want.

Pretty sure it's solo q rating.
 Ranked 5s no longer exist.

If you read [the rules](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QJNY5pk2abYrdXbC5S6vN2u6pysZRQNSZTpXe4Ix02M/edit) it gives specifics on that kind of thing
I mean, I played against you, Maraudaur, in S4 as a plat player and gave you a real dicking. I remember it like it was yesterday. You were on Jarvan, I was on Shaco, there was blood in the air.
UOA for the win :3

We started this semester 1 last year and University of New South Wales won (UoA vs UNSW in finals). In Semester 2 it was the same finals match up and University of Auckland won. So there is definitely a rivalry there!

Hi I've just looked up my Uni's teams that my team will be facing in div 2 and they have some unranked players that were previously in platinum and just haven't finished their placements. Is this going to be a problem?
Hey what university club are you apart of? best to get in touch with the club organisers.
UTS, cheers. Some of my mates in other groups are telling me there are plats who tanked ranking back to gold too.

Hi Parametrics,

I believe I've contacted you about the players in question, if you have any concerns feel free to shoot me a message :)

Cheers!

This is a bit of a difficult one, if Riot could answer would be appreciated. I live in a tiny NSW town in the middle of nowhere but we have a TAFE and because there is LITERALLY nothing to do here most of us play games (and league). We actually have some pretty decent players. I used to go to the TAFE here but for my degree I now do my course Distance Education through the TAFE in the city because Graphic Design is not available here. I have been wanting to run tournaments or an internet cafe or something here for a while now to give the people something to do. My first question is who would I talk to in Riot for help with setting up something regular for us to do. Ok now the hard one, can I start a LoL-Club for two or more schools? Seeing as not a lot is on offer here a lot of us have gone to Distance ED ( online study mainly, we havent moved, go into city occasionally) or moved but we still all want to compete together and have other people join in as well. The schools are kind of close together and none of them have a club from what I can see. Could we do a region one for the bogan TAFE's here?
Also all the TAFE's here go under the same name "Tafe Of New England" and they are all linked.

Hey man,

I'm the man you want to talk to about hosting events for your local community!

1)  "I have been wanting to run tournaments or an internet cafe or something here for a while now to give the people something to do. My first question is who would I talk to in Riot for help with setting up something regular for us to do."

Check out this awesome resource (which also talks about how to get prizing as well)
Tournament guide - http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-events/5VfpQ1pe-guide-how-to-organise-your-first-online-or-live-tournament

2) can I start a LoL-Club for two or more schools?

If you want to organise events for multiple schools/universities you can definitely do that! (I highly recommend building a team to help create awesome events though)

Check out this to help build your clubs - http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/clubs/pBvRRPrW-looking-to-start-a-uni-club-here-are-some-useful-resources

3) How does this work specifically for OUC? 

If you are have clubs for different schools/Unis then each club must submit a separate team. However if all of the TAFE's are the same school just different campuses then you can pool together to form one team.

Let me know if you have any further questions.
That actually does help, I am pretty sure we are the same TAFE just different campuses!
Can college students like me join the tournament as it counts as my first year of uni/tertiary education?
If you are in Tertiary education you can join.

hello my name is Zekabow but my YouTube name is MG ZK I JUST LOOKED AT YOUR UNIVERSITY CHAMPIONSHIPS AND I WOULD LIKE TO KNOW CAN I JOIN UP. 
BUT I'M 14 YEARS OLD SO ARE THERE TRY OUTS OR CAN I JOIN

Hey man,
This tournament is specifically for tertiary education students (uni, tafe, etc)
We definitely want to do more for high school players in the future.

For the time being though check out our events portal where you can create tournaments and we will help support with tournament prizing - http://events.oce.leagueoflegends.com/content/faq

If you have any questions about this head on over to the community events boards - http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-events/bWtno6fE-tournament-prizing-how-does-it-work
Is friends from different Uni allowed to form a team to join? All gold and below!
Teams must be from the same Uni (You are representing your uni!) Reach out to your local University Club to find a Uni team!
